snippet: President Obama and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, emerged from talks determined to avoid the pitfalls of a rising power confronting an established one.
abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama and Chinese leader Xi Jinping emerge from lengthy weekend talks declaring determination to keep disputes on cyberespionage and other issues from descending into cold war mentality; officials on both sides, however, warn that number of forces may push China and United States into just such a trap.
lead_paragraph: President Obama and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, emerged from talks determined to avoid the pitfalls of a rising power confronting an established one.

headline.seo: Obama and Xi Try to Avoid a Cold War Mentality
headline.main: Obama and Xi Try to Avoid a Cold War Mentality
headline.print_headline: Xi and Obama See Pitfalls That Might Be Difficult to Avoid
